summary:
I am a journalist, by education, by trade, and by heart. There are three red threads throughout
my career: as journalist and editor I have delivered high quality products individually. Because
of my interest in and affinity with (digital) development, I have been involved in multiple platform
development projects. And because I care, about content quality and colleagues, I handle
editorial processes and teams.

courses.name: Introduction to Running Pipe in Oil and Gas Wells

profile_positions.description:
Advario is an internationally operating chemicals, gases, fuels and new energy products storage company, headquartered in Rotterdam. Advario is ambitious and innovative, focused on the future, and ready to play its part in the energy transition. 

So where do I fit in? As Content & Communications Manager, I am going to make sure that Advario's big picture, a mosaic made up of smaller pictures, is clear. Clear to the public that relies on the products our clients provide, clear to the clients that place their trust in our company, and clear to the people that make it all possible: Advario employees and partners.

To achieve that, I am going to mix the skillset I’ve built over the course of years, taking bits and pieces from every stop along the way... a portion of the journalist’s curiosity, stubbornness and drive to tell good stories, mixed with the corporate communicator’s sense of strategy and target-setting, a dash of leadership coaching, and digital development as the cherry providing some sweetness and color.
profile_positions.title: Content & Communications Manager

profile_positions.description:
Van Oord is a Dutch marine contractor specialised in complex offshore (wind) infrastructure, land reclamation and coastal protection projects.

At Van Oord, I work as Lead Digital in the Communications department. That means I am responsible for the further development of the various internal and external digital and social channels, am responsible for the professional development and satisfaction of the people in my team, and have every opportunity to put my personal skillset – genuine curiosity translated into digital story-telling – to good use.
profile_positions.title: Lead Digital

profile_positions.description:
Shell's Corporate Relations (CR) community works to build stronger connections between Shell, our customers and partners, and our societal and governmental stakeholders. A large - and growing - portion of that CR community works from the Shell Business Operations (SBO) office in Kraków. 

My job title - Corporate Relations Adviser Technology & Corporate and Internal Communications Team Lead, more convenient when shortened to CRATCICTL - must mean that I am either the most important person in Shell, or that it's impossible to explain what I actually do. By doing the latter, I hope to prove the former.

As an individual contributor, as CR Adviser Technology, I support internal and external communications in Projects & Technology by developing clear and concise content. Projects & Technology supports Shell businesses and partners by developing energy products and solutions, creating competitive assets, and maximising the performance of existing assets. 

As CIC Team Lead I have the opportunity to work with (and facilitate) colleagues that support a variety of Shell businesses. My goal is to use my experience and industry knowledge to set my people up for success.
profile_positions.title: Corporate Relations (CR) Adviser Technology & Corporate and Internal Communications (CIC) Team Lead

profile_positions.description:
Shell's Internal Communications Centre of Excellence (CoE) is located in Kraków, Poland. It was established to develop and execute Shell's global internal communications strategy. 

As IC content adviser, I help senior leaders communicate clearly and effectively. I also coordinate editorial and further develop internal news channels. Since joining Shell, I have been involved in a series of projects, ranging from the editorial and functional communication surrounding a large office relocation, to the (re)development of leadership communication. 

In January 2018, I took on the coordination of the Projects & Technology account. As account coordinator, I've produced speeches and notes for senior leadership, advised various layers of the organisation on strategic communication, commissioned articles and guided my peers, and coordinated the flow of content.
profile_positions.title: Internal Communications Content Advisor

profile_positions.description:
The Oil & Gas Year (TOGY) provides business intelligence and communication services to the oil and gas industry. The company covers more than thirty markets worldwide, producing annual reports in the form of books, and continuously providing online content through theoilandgasyear.com and the digital business intelligence platform TOGYiN.com.

As digital products manager I focus on the editorial and technical development of the platform, and other digital TOGY content.
profile_positions.title: Digital products manager

profile_positions.description:
The Oil & Gas Year (TOGY) provides business intelligence and communication services to the oil and gas industry. The company covers more than thirty markets worldwide, producing yearly reports and online reports.

As a market research analyst, based in Istanbul, I am responsible for research, fact-checking and the correctness of our data and databases, which play a big role within the TOGY digital presence. The department reviews the data on existing markets, and researches new markets and projects.
profile_positions.title: Market Research Analyst

profile_positions.description: The Oil & Gas Year (TOGY) provides business intelligence and communication services to the oil and gas industry. The company covers more than thirty markets worldwide, producing yearly reports and online reports. For TOGY I have been stationed as a trainee in Luanda, Angola, and in Muscat, Oman. I have also contributed to the Abu Dhabi publication. Country editors are the reconnaissance units of the company, interviewing local CEO's and managers.
profile_positions.title: Country editor

profile_positions.description: I followed my then-wife to Seattle. She had the opportunity to do a paid post-doc research program. In the States I worked as a freelance journalist. I have also worked for Flexasoft, a tech company in Redmond, testing the usability and correctness of soft- and hardware for a worldwide operating company based in the area (non-disclosure agreement). The job provided valuable insight in the Seattle tech industry.
profile_positions.title: Journalist

profile_positions.description: Editor at Vox magazine, an editorially independent monthly covering the Radboud University Nijmegen. In a team of five fulltimers and ten to fifteen freelancers I was responsible for the newsroom and managed the website. In 2012, I acted as liaison between newsroom and web development during the redesign and launch of the new website, Voxweb.nl. Besides these responsibilities I contributed to both magazine and web, writing articles and longreads, doing interviews and features.
profile_positions.title: News editor Vox

profile_positions.description: Fulltime crossmedia editor at Brabants Dagblad, a provincial daily newspaper covering the Dutch Brabant province. I was part of a small group experimenting with new forms of storytelling, subsequently trying to embed the best practices in the papers daily routine. We spent half the time working in the newsroom, half the time on research and development. I'm proud of an interview series I developed, Honderduit, in which our audience participated in the process by suggesting questions. Armed with their input I did the interviews, if I used a question the paper donated a small amount of money to a regional charity.
profile_positions.title: Crossmedia editor

profile_positions.description: Parttime (20 hours) junior researcher with the journalism department at the VU University Amsterdam. I participated in research that aimed to understand local (amateur) civic journalism, and the influence it had on its surroundings. I was mainly tasked with quantitative data analysis. The work led to two research reports.
profile_positions.title: Junior Researcher

profile_positions.description: In the spring of 2003, during my bachelors, I did an internship with the aforementioned provincial daily newspaper Brabants Dagblad. It led to a freelance deal that ran until I joined them fulltime in 2010. I also interned at the national magazines Nieuwe Revu (2004) and HP/De Tijd (2008), writing about national politics and doing a cover story on tax policy.
profile_positions.title: Journalist

profile_positions.description: I worked as an assistant for the Nijmegen city council representatives of the Dutch liberal party VVD (2007-2008).
profile_positions.title: Assistant
